summary: This document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, outlining the distribution of his estate, the appointment of executors, and various powers granted to them. It includes provisions for the payment of debts, taxes, and the management of his estate's assets, as well as stipulations regarding beneficiaries and the handling of disputes related to the will.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey E. Epstein is the individual making the will, detailing how his estate should be managed and distributed after his death.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Darren K. Indyke is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will, responsible for managing the estate according to the will's provisions.

persons.name: Joseph Pagano
persons.context: Joseph Pagano is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will, tasked with overseeing the estate's administration.

persons.name: Lawrence Newman
persons.context: Lawrence Newman is appointed as one of the executors of Epstein's will, responsible for executing the terms of the will.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is named as a successor executor in the event that one of the primary executors is unable to serve.

persons.name: Andrew Farkas
persons.context: Andrew Farkas is named as a successor executor in the event that one of the primary executors is unable to serve.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: Harry I. Beller is the notary public who witnessed the signing of Epstein's will.

locations: Little St. James Island, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The document is the Last Will and Testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on January 29, 2012.
Epstein appoints Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman as executors of his will.
Jes Staley and Andrew Farkas are named as successor executors.
The will includes provisions for the payment of debts, taxes, and management of the estate's assets.
The document outlines the powers granted to the executors in managing Epstein's estate.
